unnormalised: The Income Tax Department conducted raids on multiple locations in Mumbai and Delhi on 14/03/2024, targeting several prominent CA firms suspected of facilitating tax evasion. Sources indicate that the operation, code-named "Project Transparency," was initiated based on data analytics that revealed discrepancies in the tax returns filed by certain high-net-worth individuals (HNIs) and corporations.
normalised: The Income Tax Department conducted raids on multiple locations in Mumbai and Delhi on fourteenth March two thousand and twenty four, targeting several prominent C-A firms suspected of facilitating tax evasion. Sources indicate that the operation, code-named "Project Transparency," was initiated based on data analytics that revealed discrepancies in the tax returns filed by certain high-net-worth individuals (H-N-Is) and corporations.

unnormalised: According to preliminary reports, the investigation focuses on allegations of inflating expenses, claiming fraudulent deductions u/s 80C, and concealing income through shell companies. It is also alleged that some of these CA firms provided "backdated" invoices to help clients reduce their tax liability.

It is also alleged that some of these C-A firms provided "backdated" invoices to help clients reduce their tax liability.

unnormalised: "We have reasons to believe that certain entities have been engaging in practices that violate the provisions of the Income Tax Act, 1961," stated a senior official from the IT Department, requesting anonymity. "Our objective is to ensure fair tax compliance and deter any attempts to circumvent the law." The official added that the department is examining documents and digital data seized during the raids to gather more evidence.

The official added that the department is examining documents and digital data seized during the raids to gather more evidence.

unnormalised: The raids involved teams of tax officials, police personnel, and cybersecurity experts. Several electronic devices, including laptops, hard drives, and mobile phones, were seized for forensic analysis. The IT department also recorded statements from key personnel at the CA firms and the individuals whose tax records are under scrutiny.
